en: She said that she would visit Jack with her sisters.
zh: 她说她会和姐妹们一起去看杰克。

en: He has three elder sisters.
He has three older sisters.
He's a difficult person to deal with.
He caught the first train and got there just in time.
zh: 他赶上了头班车，正好准时到了。

en: At first he didn't take kindly to his new house.
zh: 一开始，他不太喜欢他的新家。

en: At first he had trouble getting used to his new house.
zh: 一开始，他挺难适应新家的。

en: At first he had trouble adjusting to living in his new house.
zh: 一开始，他不太习惯住在新房子里。

en: He ran for Governor of the state four years ago.
zh: 四年前他参加了州长竞选。

en: He was let out after serving just two years of his four-year prison sentence.
zh: 四年刑期他只坐了两年牢就被放出来了。

en: He was spirited away by four police officers in the middle of the night.
zh: 半夜里，他被四个警察偷偷带走了。

en: He was taken away by four police officers in the middle of the night.
zh: 半夜里，他被四个警察带走了。

en: He will come back at four.
He got down on all fours and started searching for the ring.
zh: 他趴在地上找起戒指来。

en: He isn't a history major.
He passed the law examination and set up a law office.
zh: 他通过了法律考试，开了家律师事务所。

en: He was a kind master to his servants.
He earns more money than he can spend.
He has more money than can be spent.
He has more money than he can spend.
He was dressed in an old coat that had seen better days.
zh: 他穿着一件破旧的老外套。

en: He welcomed his fellow worker into his home.
zh: 他欢迎同事到他家里来。

en: He got hurt in the accident at work.
zh: 他在工作时出事故受伤了。

en: He had an accident at work.
You can't see him because he is engaged.
zh: 你现在见不到他，因为他正忙着呢。

en: He is at work now, but will be coming home at seven.
zh: 他现在在上班，七点回家。

en: He is at work now, but will return at seven.
zh: 他现在在上班，七点回来。

en: He began his career with a small vegetable cart which he took around from house to house.
zh: 他最开始是推着个小菜车挨家挨户卖菜起家的。

en: He's making a table in his workshop.
zh: 他在工作室里做桌子呢。

en: He applied for a job.
He changed his job.
He has no interests, apart from his work.
zh: 除了工作，他没什么别的爱好。

en: He interrupted his work to answer the phone.
zh: 他停下手头的工作去接了个电话。

en: He is very accurate in his work.
He'll do his best to finish the job.
zh: 他会尽力完成这项工作的。

en: When he finished the work, he went home.
zh: 工作一结束，他就回家了。

en: As soon as he finished his work, he went home.
zh: 他一干完活儿就回家了。

en: After he had finished his work, he would read and study by the fireside.
zh: 干完活后，他常会坐在壁炉旁读书学习。

en: He was at pains to finish his work.
zh: 他费了好大劲才把工作干完。

en: He has finished his work, hasn't he?
He put his tools away after he had finished.
zh: 干完活后，他把工具收了起来。

en: He seems to have finished his work.
Having finished his work, he telephoned his wife.
zh: 干完活后，他给他老婆打了个电话。

en: He finished his work.
He didn't have as much trouble finding a job as he thought he would.
zh: 找工作没他想象的那么难。

en: He took over the business.
He works slowly, because he takes things seriously.
zh: 他干活慢是因为他做事很认真。

en: He regretted having quit his job.
He not only has a job but does the housework.
zh: 他不光要上班，还要做家务。

en: He had to, but didn't want to, do the job.
zh: 他不想干这活儿，但又不得不干。

en: He has finished up his work.
He goofed on the job and got fired.
zh: 他工作搞砸了，结果被炒了。

en: He stuck to his job.
zh: 他一直坚持干这份工作。

en: He was honest in business.
He has been in deep water since he got fired from his job.
zh: 他被开除以后，日子一直挺难过的。

en: He has no distinct idea of how to proceed.
zh: 他没想好接下来该怎么办。

en: He has more experience on the job than I.
He was impeded in his work.
He is an eager beaver.
His work occupies his mind to the exclusion of all else.
zh: 他一心扑在工作上，别的啥也不管。

en: Business prevented him from going to the concert.
zh: 他因为忙生意的事儿没去成音乐会。

en: He is absorbed in his work.
He is very close about his work.
zh: 他对他工作的事守口如瓶。

en: He directed all his energy to his business.
zh: 他把心思全放在生意上了。

en: He couldn't make it in business.
He acquainted himself with his job.
zh: 他熟悉了一下手头的工作。

en: He attended to his business.
He set about his work.
He applied for the job but was turned down on the spot.
zh: 他申请了那份工作，但当场就被刷了。

en: Work absorbs most of his time.
zh: 工作占用了他大部分时间。

en: He shows great enthusiasm for his work.
He combines work with pleasure.
He will never get over his huge business losses.
zh: 生意亏了这么多，他估计这辈子都缓不回来了。

en: He went to Nagoya on business.
He is busy with his work.
He is to go to Tokyo on business.
He's out of town on business.
The task absorbed all his energies.
zh: 这任务让他费尽了心思。

en: He succeeded in business.
He has gone to New York on business.
As soon as work is over, he makes a beeline for the pub.
zh: 他一干完活就直奔酒吧。

en: He let out a sigh when the job was finished.
zh: 活儿干完后，他松了口气。

en: He is careless and untidy in his work.
zh: 他干活丢三落四的，邋里邋遢。

en: He complained that he couldn't find a job.
He made the best of the time left.
zh: 他尽量利用了剩下的时间。

en: He was excused from the remainder of the work.
zh: 剩下的活儿不用他干了。

en: He made the best use of the time left.
zh: 他把剩下的时间都好好利用了。

en: He died from lack of oxygen.
He nodded as much as to say that he agreed.
zh: 他点点头，表示他同意了。

en: He seems not to agree.
He was blind from birth.
Whenever he goes out for a walk, he takes his dog with him.
zh: 他每次出去散步都带着狗。

en: He has gone out for a walk.
He is taking a walk.
He's out taking a walk.
He likes a walk.
He must like taking walks.
There's no doubt that he likes taking walks.
zh: 毫无疑问，他挺喜欢散步的。

en: He fells trees in the mountain.
He cuts down trees in the mountains.
He likes mountaineering and is at home with Japanese mountains.
zh: 他很喜欢登山，对日本的山特别熟。

en: He likes mountaineering and is well acquainted with the mountains of Japan.
zh: 他喜欢爬山，对日本的山很了解。

en: He likes mountaineering and knows the mountains of Japan quite well.
zh: 他喜欢登山，对日本的山头都很熟。

en: He fell down in the mountain.
He left for the mountain never to return.
zh: 他进了山就再也没回来。

en: He was standing at the top of the mountain.
He came from a tiny mountain town.
He stared at the steep slope of the mountain and stopped climbing it.
zh: 他盯着陡峭的山坡看了一会儿，就不爬了。

en: He used his umbrella as a weapon.
He left his umbrella in the bus.
zh: 他把雨伞忘在公交车上了。

en: He left his umbrella on the bus.
zh: 他把伞落在公交车上了。

en: He has been keeping company with Mary for three years.
zh: 他和玛丽在一起三年了。

en: He was the champion for three years.
He left three days ago.
He came back three days after.
He came back home three days later.
He has been unconscious for three days.
He is leaving in three days.
He won the third prize.
He is sure to set a new record in the triple jump.
zh: 他肯定能在三级跳远中打破纪录。

en: He crossed the Pacific Ocean in thirty days.
zh: 他花了三十天横渡太平洋。

en: He came to Tokyo at the age of three.
zh: 他三岁的时候来到了东京。

en: He has been to London three times.
He ate three and said he could eat as many again.
zh: 他吃了三个，还说能再吃三个。

en: He'd been three months in the job and the strain was beginning to tell on him.
zh: 他干这工作三个月了，高压之下他快撑不住了。

en: He pulled up the weed and threw it away.
When he opens a magazine, he will usually read his horoscope first.
zh: 他翻开杂志时，通常会先看星座运势。

en: He is guilty of murder.
He was in charge of preparing a magazine for publication.
zh: 他负责一本杂志的出版筹备工作。

en: He has a morbid fondness for murder mysteries.
zh: 他对谋杀小说有种病态的迷恋。

en: He brought out the truth of the murder case.
zh: 他揭露了这起谋杀案的真相。

en: He was surprised to hear about the murder case.
zh: 听说这桩谋杀案，他感到很吃惊。

en: He was involved in a murder case.
He was found guilty of murder.
zh: 他被判定谋杀罪名成立。

en: He was convicted of murder.
He was accused of murder.
He was tried for murder.
He was hanged for murder.
He was sent to jail for murder.
zh: 他因谋杀被关进了监狱。

en: He is accused of murder.
He will do anything but murder.
zh: 除了杀人，他什么都愿意干。

en: He witnessed the murder.
He was guilty of murder.
He was arrested for murder.
He was framed for murder.
He is chargeable with murder.
The story goes that he was murdered.
He cut down a cherry tree.
He was maneuvered out of office.
zh: 他被人耍手段弄下了台。

en: He came home late last night.
He sat up late last night.
He stayed up late last night.
He went on working without a break last night.
zh: 他昨晚一直在工作，中间都没休息。

en: He worked last night without taking a break.
zh: 他昨晚干活一直没歇着。

en: He had his car stolen last night.
He slept well last night.
He practices playing the guitar far into the night.
He practices playing the guitar until late at night.
zh: 他练吉他一直练到很晚。

en: He need not have come to the party last night.
zh: 他昨晚其实没必要来参加聚会的。

en: He appeared on TV last night.
He appeared on television last night.
zh: 他昨晚在电视上露面了。

en: He sat up late last night working on the documents.
He was working at the office yesterday evening.
zh: 他昨天傍晚在办公室加班。

en: He saw a UFO flying last night.
He went to bed at eleven last night.
He came back at about nine last night.
zh: 他昨晚九点左右回来的。

en: He came back about nine last night.
zh: 他昨晚大概九点回来的。

en: He painted an image he had during meditation last night.
zh: 他画了幅昨晚冥想时出现的画面。

en: He wishes he had gone to the theater last night.
zh: 他要是昨晚去了剧院就好了。

en: He watched a basketball game on TV last night.
zh: 他昨晚在电视上看了一场篮球赛。

en: He has been sick since last night.
zh: 他从昨晚起就一直病着。

en: Was he in Hokkaido last year?
He changed schools last year.
He graduated from college last year.
He had a new house built last year.
He failed in his business last year.
He visited Kyoto last year.
He made a will last year.
He was traveling in the Philippines this time of last year.
zh: 去年这时候他正在菲律宾旅游呢。

en: He was traveling in the Philippines this time last year.
zh: 去年这个时候他在菲律宾旅游。

en: He intended to have visited Naples last year.
zh: 他去年本来打算去那不勒斯的。

en: He tried to give up smoking last year, but it was in vain.
zh: 他去年试过戒烟，但没成功。

en: He joined the club last year.
zh: 他去年加入了那个俱乐部。

en: He got into this school in September last year.
zh: 他是去年九月进的这所学校。

en: He failed to come yesterday.
He arrived here safely yesterday.
He went to school to study yesterday.
He was absent from school yesterday because he was ill.
zh: 他昨天因为生病没去学校。

en: He was absent from school yesterday because he was sick.
He read a most interesting novel yesterday.
zh: 他昨天读了一本非常有意思的小说。

en: The hospital took him in yesterday.
He looks pleased with his new car which he bought yesterday.
zh: 他对他昨天买的新车看着挺满意的。

en: He arrived in Japan yesterday.
He went to Tokyo yesterday.
He came from Tokyo yesterday.
He was behind time yesterday.
He visited his uncle yesterday.
He was operated on yesterday.
He had his car stolen yesterday.
He got hurt in the game yesterday.
zh: 他昨天在比赛中受伤了。

en: He called on me yesterday.
He took me to the park yesterday.
He forgot to come to see me yesterday.
He died yesterday.
He bought a pair of black shoes yesterday.
He was absent from school yesterday.
He was late for school yesterday.
He returned from abroad yesterday.
He did not eat anything yesterday.
Last night, he studied all night long.
Did he study English yesterday?
He left for London yesterday.
He got to London yesterday.
He is better today than yesterday.
zh: 他今天比昨天好点儿了。

en: He feels a good deal better than yesterday.
He was really off the wall yesterday.
zh: 他昨天表现得挺离谱的。

en: He was watching TV last night.
He came to meet me yesterday afternoon.
He met the girl on his way home yesterday.
zh: 他昨天在回家路上碰到那个女孩了。

en: Was he in New York yesterday?
It was not until yesterday that he noticed her.
zh: 直到昨天他才注意到她。

en: He cut himself with a knife yesterday.
He injured himself with a knife yesterday.
He played tennis yesterday.
He was present at the meeting yesterday.
He attended the party yesterday.
He bought six cakes of soap yesterday.
He admitted John yesterday.
He allowed John to enter yesterday.
zh: 他昨天准许约翰进去了。

en: He read this book yesterday.
He is not the boy who came here yesterday.
zh: 他不是昨天来的那个男孩。

en: He set out for Canada yesterday.
zh: 他昨天动身去加拿大了。

en: He started for America yesterday.
Having failed twice yesterday, he doesn't want to try again.
zh: 昨天失败了两次，他不想再试了。

en: He worked all day yesterday.
He called on me at my office yesterday.
zh: 他昨天到办公室来找我了。

en: He stopped playing baseball last season.
zh: 他从上个赛季起就不打棒球了。

en: He wrote his comments in the margin of the composition.
zh: 他在作文的页边写了评语。

en: He is awkward in his manners.
He made many grammatical mistakes in his composition.
zh: 他作文里有很多语法错误。

en: He has an ambition to make a name for himself as a writer.
He is admired as a writer.
zh: 他作为一个作家很受推崇。

en: He is a teacher rather than a writer.
zh: 与其说他是作家，不如说他是老师。

en: He is a writer and a statesman.
zh: 他既是作家也是政治家。

en: He writes books.
He's an author.
He is a writer.
He had his wallet stolen.
He took out the wallet from his inside jacket pocket.
zh: 他从夹克内袋里掏出了钱包。

en: He was out of humor as he had lost his wallet.
zh: 因为丢了钱包，他心情很不好。

en: He said that he had left his wallet at home.
zh: 他说他把钱包忘在家里了。

en: He took out a dollar from his wallet.
zh: 他从钱包里拿出一块钱。

en: He is financially embarrassed.
He is badly situated financially.
He claimed to be an expert in finance.
He consumed his fortune gambling.
He passed his property on to his son.
zh: 他把财产传给了他儿子。

en: He has disposed of what was left of his estate.
zh: 他把剩下的家产都处理掉了。

en: He is none the happier for his wealth.
zh: 有钱并没让他变得更快乐。

en: His wealth has not made him happy.
zh: 财富并没有带给他快乐。

en: He is doing penance.
They sought to punish him for his crime but he escaped.
zh: 他们想惩罚他的罪行，但他逃跑了。

en: He admitted having done wrong.
He conceded that he committed a crime.
He admitted that he had committed the crime.
zh: 他承认那桩罪行是他干的。

en: He may as well confess his crimes.
zh: 他不如干脆交代了自己的罪行。

en: He was absolved of his sin.
His sense of guilt was diminished.
He was eaten up with guilt.
He was tortured by guilt.
He was egging an innocent young man on to join him in his crooked deal.
zh: 他在怂恿一个无辜的年轻人跟他一起干勾当。

en: I wonder if he's at home.
Is he at home?
He is at home, but no one can see him.
He made no end of excuses.
He was raised to the bench.
He appealed to the judge for mercy.
He pleaded with the judge for mercy.
He pleaded self-defense at the trial and went scot-free.
zh: 他在审判中辩称是正当防卫，最后被无罪释放了。

en: He grows tomatoes in his garden.
zh: 他在自家花园里种西红柿。

en: He took great care, yet he made a mistake.
zh: 他已经很小心了，但还是出了错。

en: He keeps a toyshop in a small way.
zh: 他经营着一家小玩具店。

en: He walked to and fro on the stage.
He took no photos of the festival.
zh: 节日期间他一张照片也没拍。

en: He became more obstinate as he grew older.
He did justice to his talent.
zh: 他充分发挥了自己的才华。

en: He was promoted by virtue of his abilities.
zh: 他凭着自己的能力获得了晋升。

en: With all the talent he has, he never makes any effort.
zh: 尽管有天赋，他却从不努力。

en: With his wife and children in the country, he was at loose ends for something to do.
zh: 老婆孩子都在乡下，他闲得不知道该干啥。

en: He abandoned his family.
He abandoned his wife and children.
He is alleged to have poisoned his wife.
zh: 据说他毒死了自己的妻子。

en: He trusts his wife to a great extent.
He was jealous of his wife.
Losing his wife drove him to steal.
zh: 丧妻之痛逼得他去偷东西。

en: He began to indulge in drinking after he lost his wife.
zh: 妻子去世后，他开始借酒消愁。

en: I do not think he will ever get over the loss of his wife.
zh: 我觉得他永远无法走出丧妻之痛。

en: He endeavored to make his wife happy, but in vain.
zh: 他竭力想让妻子开心，但终究徒劳。

en: He tried to make his wife happy, but in vain.
zh: 他想让妻子开心，但没成功。

en: He tried to make his wife happy, but he couldn't.
zh: 他想让妻子开心，但没能做到。

en: He bent over backward to please his wife.
zh: 他为了讨好老婆，真是费尽了心思。

en: He survived his wife.
He is even older than his wife.
He has no wife, no children and no friends.
zh: 他没老婆，没孩子，也没朋友。

en: He is afraid his wife is not very domestic.
zh: 他担心他老婆不怎么顾家。

en: He frowns on his wife's wasting money.
zh: 他很看不惯他老婆乱花钱。

en: He survived his wife for many years.
zh: 他老婆去世后，他又活了很多年。

en: After his wife died, he lived for quite a few more years.
zh: 他老婆去世后，他又活了好些年。

en: He is discouraged over his wife's death.
zh: 他因为老婆去世变得很消沉。

en: He hasn't got over the death of his wife yet.
zh: 他还没从老婆去世的打击中走出来。

en: He was filled with anxiety about his wife's return.
zh: 他对他老婆要回来这件事感到很焦虑。

en: He was angry with his wife.
He wrote a book based on an idea which he borrowed from his wife.
zh: 他根据从他老婆那儿得到的灵感写了一本书。

en: He persuaded his wife not to divorce him.
zh: 他劝他老婆别跟他离婚。

en: He does not need a wife to look after him.
zh: 他不需要老婆来照顾他。

en: He entreated his wife not to leave him.
zh: 他苦苦哀求他老婆别离开他。

en: He told his wife not to buy on impulse.
zh: 他跟他老婆说别冲动购物。

en: He related to his wife something interesting about his employer.
zh: 他跟老婆讲了件关于他老板的趣事。

en: He reminded his wife to wake him up at 7:00 a.m.
zh: 他提醒他老婆早上七点叫他起床。

en: He was in deep grief at the death of his wife.
zh: 他老婆去世了，他感到非常悲伤。

en: He asked his wife if she was coming with him.
zh: 他问他老婆要不要跟他一块儿去。

en: He seldom gives his wife presents.
He got his shirt mended by his wife.
zh: 他让他老婆帮他补了件衬衫。

en: He said to his wife "Are you coming with me"?
zh: 他对他老婆说：“你跟我一块儿去吗？”

en: He concealed the fact that he had divorced his wife.
zh: 他隐瞒了自己已经和老婆离婚的事实。

en: He is living apart from his wife.
He lives at peace with his wife.
zh: 他和他老婆相处得很和睦。

en: He stopped smoking because his wife and children asked him to.
zh: 因为老婆孩子都让他戒，他就把烟戒了。

en: He cooked meals for himself when his wife was sick.
zh: 他老婆生病的时候，他就自己做饭吃。

en: He has taken to drinking since the death of his wife.
zh: 自从老婆去世后，他就开始酗酒了。

en: He felt great sorrow when his wife died.
zh: 他老婆去世的时候，他特别难过。

en: He objected to his wife working outside.
zh: 他反对他老婆出去工作。

en: He would do his best.
He will do his best.
I think he will do his best.
He did his best, but failed.
zh: 他已经尽力了，但还是失败了。

en: He did his best, in vain.
zh: 他尽了最大努力，结果还是白搭。

en: He tried his best only to fail again.
zh: 他尽了全力，结果还是又失败了。

en: He did his best and still had poor marks.
zh: 他都尽力了，可成绩还是很差。

en: He did his best; otherwise he would not have won the first prize.
zh: 他是拼尽全力了，不然拿不到第一名。

en: He did his best.
At first he hated her but gradually came to love her.
zh: 一开始他挺讨厌她的，后来慢慢喜欢上她了。

en: He was a writer who had never lived up to the promise of his first novel.
zh: 他是个作家，但再也没写出过像第一本小说那样出色的作品了。

en: On hearing the news of the birth of his first child, he jumped for joy.
zh: 听到第一个孩子出生的消息，他高兴得跳了起来。

en: He couldn't carry out his first plan.
zh: 他的第一个计划没能执行下去。

en: He hit the center of the target with his first shot.
He was the first man to cross the Pacific.
zh: 他是第一个横跨太平洋的人。

en: He is the first Japanese that traveled in space.
zh: 他是第一个进入太空的日本人。

en: At first, he sounded very sincere.
zh: 一开始，他听起来挺有诚意的。

en: He went to a fruit store first.
When he missed the last train, he was at a loss.
zh: 没赶上末班车，他当时不知所措。

en: He missed the last train.
He dashed to catch the last train.
He is busy with the final draft.
He said that the last bus leaves at 10:50 p.m.
zh: 他说末班车是晚上十点五十开。

en: He was in time for the last bus.
He is said to have been the best football player.
zh: 据说他以前是最好的足球运动员。

en: They say he is the best tennis player.
zh: 大家都说他是最棒的网球选手。

en: He remained faithful to the last.
zh: 他直到最后都保持着忠诚。

en: He did not know what to do to the end.
zh: 他直到最后都不知道该怎么办。

en: He will end up in prison.
He is shivering on the brink.
zh: 他在悬崖边缘瑟瑟发抖。

en: He breathed his last breath.
He canceled the appointment at the last moment.
zh: 他在最后一刻取消了约会。

en: He was in the process of making a final decision.
zh: 他当时正在做最后的决定。

en: He left the last page blank.
He was the last person to arrive.
He ended up in jail.
He finally surrendered to her.
zh: 他最终还是向她妥协了。

en: He is sure of success in the end.
zh: 他确信自己最后会成功。

en: He finally yielded to the request of his wife and bought a house.
zh: 他最后还是听了老婆的话，买了房子。

en: He finished last but one.
He is depressed lately.
He is well off nowadays.
zh: 他现在日子过得挺滋润的。

en: He has been working very hard of late.
He easily gets angry nowadays.
He has taken to drinking recently.
He has recently failed, but he is still full of hope.
zh: 他最近失败了，但他依然充满希望。

en: He set up a company recently.
He took a cold bath even in winter until recently.
zh: 直到最近，他甚至在冬天都还洗冷水澡。

en: He has recently returned from France.
Recently, he's been drinking too much.
zh: 他最近喝得有点太凶了。

en: He got a nice job recently.
zh: 他最近找了份不错的工作。

en: He hasn't been much in evidence recently.
Recently he's become a really nice person.
He's been feeling a little on edge recently.
zh: 他最近感觉神经有点紧绷。

en: He prepared for the worst.
It is necessary that he should prepare for the worst.
zh: 他有必要做好最坏的打算。

en: It is necessary that he prepare for the worst.
He is among the best jazz singers.
zh: 他是顶尖的爵士歌手之一。

en: He likes the most beautiful flower.
zh: 他喜欢最漂亮的那朵花。

en: He is up for reelection.
He tried it over and over again.
He was never to see his parents again.
zh: 他再也没能见到他的父母。

en: He was never to see his mother again.
zh: 他再也没能见到他母亲。

en: Do you think he will be elected president again?
zh: 你觉得他还会再次当选总统吗？

en: He made up his mind to try again.
He was never to see his native land again.
He was never to return to his hometown.
He tried it again, only to fail.
zh: 他又试了一次，结果还是失败了。

en: He tried it again, but in vain.
zh: 他又试了一遍，但还是没用。

en: He gave way to the temptation again.
He sat in Zen meditation.
He rose from his seat.
As soon as he sat down, he picked up the telephone.
zh: 他刚坐下就拿起了电话。

en: He sat reading with his wife sewing by the fire.
zh: 他坐在火炉边看书，他妻子在旁边缝衣服。

en: He sat reading a book.
He sat reading, with his wife sewing by the fire.
zh: 他坐着看书，他妻子在火炉旁缝补。

en: He sat looking out of the window.
He sat reading a weekly magazine.
He sat reading a magazine, with his wife knitting beside him.
zh: 他坐着看杂志，他妻子在旁边织毛衣。

en: He sat listening to the radio.
He sat smoking, with his wife sewing beside him.
zh: 他坐着抽烟，他妻子在旁边缝东西。

en: He likes coffee without sugar.
He mixed sugar with milk.
He uses honey instead of sugar.
He likes drinking coffee without sugar.
zh: 他喜欢喝不加糖的咖啡。

en: He broke his left arm.
He scooped up sand by the handful.
zh: 他一把一把地捧起沙子。

en: He hurt his left hand.
He had an operation on his left leg.
He caught the ball with his left hand.
He raised his hands one after the other.
He gets angry over trivial things.
He tends to get angry over trifles.
zh: 他爱为鸡毛蒜皮的小事发脾气。

en: He is cool amid confusion.
He chafed under the groundless criticism.
zh: 他对那些无端指责感到很恼火。

en: He is, at bottom, an honest man.
He was a good fellow at heart.
zh: 他那时候心肠其实挺好的。

en: He is a good fellow at heart.
He is the essence of kindness.
He is a scholar to the core.
zh: 他是个地地道道的学者。

en: He is a kind man at heart.
He has an interest in collecting insects.
zh: 他对收集昆虫很感兴趣。

en: He turned away from them in embarrassment.
zh: 他尴尬地把脸转了过去。

en: He made his way through difficulties.
He will cope well with difficulties.
He was confronted with some difficulties.
He got over his difficulties.
He is used to hard work.
He never turns his back on a friend in need.
zh: 他从不背弃患难中的朋友。

en: He could not forsake his friend in trouble.
zh: 他不会抛弃身处困境的朋友。

en: He was always ready to help people in trouble.
He seems to be in trouble.
When he is in trouble, he always turns to his sister for help.
zh: 他一有麻烦总是找他姐姐帮忙。

en: He's at church right now.
He anticipates that he will be in trouble.
zh: He anticipates that he will be in trouble.

en: He may come and see us tonight.
zh: 他今晚可能会来看我们。

en: He promised to come home early tonight.
He is writing a letter to his parents now.
He won't turn up tonight.
He is leaving Narita for Hawaii this evening.
zh: 他今天晚上离开成田去夏威夷。

en: Will he come this evening?
Will he be coming this evening?
He has just come back.
He is reading a book. Let's leave him alone.
He's writing a book now.
He is having lunch.
He is now setting things in order in his room.
zh: 他这会儿正在屋里收拾东西呢。

en: I wonder if he'll come tonight.
zh: 我在想他今晚会不会来。

en: He looks tired this evening.
He will reach Hakodate tonight.
He is to come to my house tonight.
He is being Nelson tonight.
He is acting like Nelson tonight.
zh: 他今晚表现得像纳尔逊似的。

en: He will be here all evening.
zh: 他整个晚上都会在这儿。

en: He becomes a university student this year.
He has set up three world records in swimming this year.
zh: 他今年破了三项游泳世界纪录。

en: He's a student who I'm teaching English to this year.
zh: 他是我今年教英语的学生。

en: He is a student to whom I'm teaching English this year.
zh: 他是我今年带的英语课学生。

en: He traveled through the Tohoku district this summer.
zh: 他今年夏天去东北地区旅游了。

en: He has grown three centimeters this year.
He is now in the hospital and his life is in the balance.
zh: 他现在在医院，还没脱离生命危险。

en: He will not come today.
He may come today.
He'll go to the hospital today.
He is absent from school today.
I doubt if he'll come to school today.
zh: 我怀疑他今天未必会来学校。

en: He plays in the outfield today.
He is at home today.
He is being very kind today.
zh: 他今天表现得特别和气。

en: He is also returning late today.
zh: 他今天也要晚点儿回来。

en: He is off duty today.
He is being kind today.
He is being earnest today.
He is in high spirits today.
He is a shade better today.
He is off today.
He cannot come to the office today as he is indisposed.
zh: 他今天身体不舒服，不能来办公室。

en: Since he doesn't feel well today, he can't come to the office.
zh: 因为他今天不舒服，所以来不了办公室。

en: He can't come to the office today because he doesn't feel well.
zh: 他今天不舒服，来不了公司。

en: He doesn't have to go to school today.
He is supposed to be at home today.
zh: 按理说他今天应该在家。

en: He is not at home to anybody today.
It seems that he is very busy today.
He feels a lot better today.
He looks a good deal better today.
For a professional, he gave a poor account of himself in today's game.
zh: 作为一个职业选手，他今天比赛的表现挺差劲的。

en: He didn't want to take today's test, so he made believe that he was sick, and didn't go to school.
zh: 他今天不想考试，就装病没去学校。

en: He will be coming to see me this afternoon.
He will look in on me again this afternoon.
zh: 他今天下午会再来看我。

en: He will play tennis with his friends.
He wants to play soccer this afternoon.
zh: 他今天下午想去踢足球。

en: He is to phone me this afternoon.
zh: 他今天下午要给我打电话。

en: He's coming back from America a week from today.
zh: 他下周的今天从美国回来。

en: He will be back a week from today, that is, on December 10.
zh: 他下周的今天回来，也就是12月10号。

en: He is pretty well today.
He is taking a day off today.
He brought his lunch today.
He is crossing the street now.
He is living in Tokyo.
He will play golf next Sunday.
zh: 他下周日要去打高尔夫。

en: He is not running in the coming election.
zh: 他不参加接下来的选举。

en: He will get his job back at the next election.
zh: 他在下次选举中会重新任职。

en: I wonder when he will come next time.
zh: 我在想他下次什么时候来。

en: He's now on the phone.
He is not available.
He's not available.
He went for a walk with her this morning.
zh: 他今天早上和她去散步了。

en: He set out for Tokyo this morning.
zh: 他今天早上动身去东京了。

en: He got up early this morning.
He overslept this morning.
He shot himself this morning.
zh: 他今天早上开枪自杀了。

en: He got up in the morning.
He breathed his last peacefully this morning.
zh: 他今天早上安详地去世了。

en: He got up earlier than usual this morning.
zh: 他今天早上起得比平时早。

en: He has been writing poems since this morning.
zh: 他从今天早上开始就在写诗。

en: He has been busy since this morning.
zh: 他从今天早上一直忙到现在。

en: He received a good many letters this morning.
zh: 他今天早上收到了好多信。

en: He received quite a few letters this morning.
zh: 他今天早上收到了不少信。

en: He is having lunch now.
He is dead and buried now.
He is now in the prime of manhood.
He is very busy now.
He is running now.
It may safely be said that he is the greatest pianist in the twentieth century.
zh: 完全可以说他就是20世纪最伟大的钢琴家。

en: He is studying in the library now.
He's eating lunch now.
He is older and wiser now.
zh: 他现在年纪大了，也更明智了。

en: He's reading a novel now.
He's reading a novel right now.
He is making the document now.
He is leaving home now.
He's busy with his homework now.
zh: 他现在正忙着写作业呢。

en: He has been busy this week.
He has been very busy this week.
He put in ten hours of overtime this week.
He is deeply in debt now.
He is at work now, but will come back at seven.
zh: 他现在在上班，七点回来。

en: He is in London on business now.
He is in trouble now.
Now he is recognized as one of the most promising writers.
zh: 他现在被公认为是最有前途的作家之一。

en: He will have reached Osaka by now.
zh: 他这会儿应该已经到大阪了。

en: He stayed with us until the beginning of this month.
zh: 他一直跟我们住到这个月初。

en: He ought to have arrived there by now.
zh: 他这会儿应该已经到那儿了。

en: He hasn't yet turned in the report this month.
zh: 这个月的报告他还没交。

en: He laid by 100 dollars this month.
He's in a bad temper.
He is now at the desk.
This is his sixth accident.
zh: 这已经是他第六次出事故了。

en: He has hardly studied this term.
zh: 这学期他几乎没怎么学习。

en: He is in conference now.
What is he up to now?
What is he doing now?
He is not studying English now.
He is the last person I want to see now.
zh: 他是我现在最不想见到的人。

en: He is now either in Rome or in Paris.
zh: 他现在不是在罗马，就是在巴黎。

en: He is on the radio.
He is not the coward that he was ten years ago.
zh: 他已经不是十年前那个懦夫了。

en: He doesn't live here anymore.
So far, he has been extremely happy.
zh: 到目前为止，他过得非常开心。

en: He is the greatest singer that ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最伟大的歌手。

en: He's never had to earn his own living.
zh: 他从来没靠自己赚过钱。

en: He's got the biggest eyebrows I've ever seen.
zh: 他的眉毛是我见过最浓的。

en: He has never been late for school.
He has never been to Okinawa before.
zh: 他以前从来没去过冲绳。

en: He has never been abroad.
He has so far been silent about his intention.
zh: 到目前为止，他对自己打算做什么一直守口如瓶。

en: He has written five books so far.
zh: 到目前为止，他已经写了五本书了。

en: He has built two houses so far.
zh: 到目前为止，他已经盖了两栋房子了。

en: He is as brave a man as ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最勇敢的人。

en: He is as diligent a man as ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最勤奋的人。

en: He is as great a musician as ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最伟大的音乐家。

en: He has been a good companion to me.
zh: 他一直是我很好的伙伴。

en: He has little money with him.
He is on another phone at the moment.
zh: 他这会儿在接另一个电话。

en: He is swimming in the pool.
He's now on the boat.
He's now aboard the ship.
He is now on the way to recovery.
He is now staying in Paris.
He doesn't live there anymore.
He is now a senior at Harvard.
zh: 他现在是哈佛的大四学生。

en: He is sure to pass the exam if he studies at this rate.
zh: 照这个势头学下去，他肯定能通过考试。

en: He should have been back by this time.
zh: 这会儿他应该已经回来了。

en: He's beginning to cry.
He'll be here any moment.
I'm sure he's going to be somebody someday.
zh: 我敢说他总有一天会出人头地的。

en: He is now in a very difficult situation.
zh: 他现在的处境非常艰难。

en: I wonder where he is now.
zh: 我想知道他现在人在哪儿。

en: Where is he running now?
He is watching TV now.
He still comes to see me now and then.
zh: 他现在还时不时地来看我。

en: He still writes novels from time to time, but not as often as he used to.
zh: 他现在还偶尔写写小说，但没以前那么勤了。

en: He still rings me from time to time.
zh: 他还时不时给我打个电话。

en: He still writes to me from time to time.
He is not what he was.
He is still aching for his home.
He is not the active person he used to be.
zh: 他不像以前那么活跃了。

en: He doesn't work here now, but he used to work here.
zh: 他现在不在这儿干了，但以前是在这儿工作的。

en: He is not the rough motorcycle gang member he was before.
zh: 他不再是以前那个粗野的飞车党了。

en: Need he go right now?
Does he need to go right now?
Does he need to go right away?
He will be back in a second.
He will be back shortly.
He'll be back home soon.
He may leave any minute.
He should be back any minute now.
He has just set out toward town.
He left the office just now.
He should have arrived by this time.
zh: 这会儿他应该已经到了。

en: He ought to have arrived in New York by now.
He ought to have arrived in New York about this time.
zh: 这个点儿他应该已经到纽约了。

en: He should have finished his work by now.
zh: 他这会儿应该已经干完活了。

en: He hasn't been here long.
He has arrived here now.
He is now playing tennis on the court.
zh: 他现在在球场打网球呢。

en: He left his country two years ago.
He has a cold now.
He's out now.
He isn't here now.
He's now short of money.
He is very busy with some important work now.
zh: 他现在正忙着一件很重要的事呢。

en: Is he studying now?
He'll be out at lunch now, so there's no point phoning straight away.
zh: 他这会儿肯定吃午饭去了，现在打电话也没用。

en: He is now looking for a bigger house to live in.
zh: 他现在正找个大点儿的房子住呢。

en: The door is being painted by him.
He is very sullen now.
He is better off now than he was three years ago.
zh: 他现在的日子过得比三年前好多了。

en: He has an eye for antiques.
He is rotten to the core.
He is Japanese to the bone.
zh: 他骨子里就是个日本人。

en: He settled down to his work.
zh: 他定下心来开始工作了。

en: He got wet from the waist to the knees.
zh: 他腰到膝盖那段儿都湿了。

en: He drew two squares on the blackboard.
zh: 他在黑板上画了两个正方形。

en: He has a habit of looking down on coloured people.
zh: 他习惯瞧不起有色人种。

en: He wore a dark sweater.
He was dressed in black.
Since he was dressed in black, he looked like a priest.
zh: 他穿了一身黑，看着像个神父。

en: He wears black-rimmed glasses.
He caught a terrible cold.
He deals in grain.
He is busy with affairs of state.
zh: 他正忙着处理国家大事。

en: He is often referred to as a national hero.
He became a national hero.
He had national welfare at heart.
He is famous both at home and abroad.
He traveled around the country.
He traveled throughout the country.
He is known to the entire country.
He decided on international relations.
zh: 他选定了国际关系方向。

en: He likes Japanese, and he's good at it.
zh: 他喜欢日语，而且学得挺好。

en: He ran for his life at the sight of the border guard.
zh: 他一看到边防兵就拼命逃命。

en: He passed across the border.
He was elected a member of parliament.
He has been elected to Congress.
He has numerous friends in the Diet.
He has a seat in the Diet.
zh: 他在国会占有一席之地。

en: He was awarded a knighthood in acknowledgement of his services to the nation.
zh: 为了表彰他对国家的贡献，他被授予了爵位。

en: He is much concerned about the future of the country.
zh: 他非常关心国家的未来。

en: He gave up his life for his country.
He works for the good of the country.
zh: 他为了国家利益而工作。

en: He did not fail to confess.
He gave his life for his country.
He had hoped to found a new company after the merger was complete.
zh: 他本想在合并完成后创办一家新公司。

en: He carved his way to fame.
zh: 他凭自己的努力成名了。

en: He was raised in the States, but his mother tongue is Japanese.
zh: 他是在美国长大的，但母语是日语。

en: He was raised in the United States, but his native language is Japanese.
zh: 他是在美国长大的，但他的母语是日语。

en: He went fishing in between.
zh: 他中间抽空去钓了个鱼。

en: He has a good fastball.
He is very concerned about his elderly parent's health.
zh: 他非常关心年迈父母的健康。

en: He lends money at a high rate of interest.
He was a famous poet and a competent diplomat.
zh: 他是位著名的诗人，也是位出色的外交官。

en: He is a famous painter and should be treated as such.
zh: 他是个著名的画家，理应受到相应的礼遇。

en: He is free from pride.
They must've skipped out of town.
He seems delirious with a high fever.
He is not a high school student.
He came by the freeway.
He maintained a steady speed on the highway.
zh: 他在高速公路上保持匀速行驶。

en: He joined the company right after he got through high school.
zh: 他高中一毕业就进这家公司了。

en: He has been playing chess since he was in high school.
zh: 他从高中起就一直在下棋。

en: He dropped out of high school.
He is married to a high school teacher.
He is a student at a high school.
He's a high school student.
He teaches English grammar at a high school.
He attended the high school for three years without missing a single day or being late.
zh: 他上高中三年，从没迟到或缺过课。

en: He suffered from high blood pressure.
He has a fabulous reputation for his high integrity.
zh: 他人品极好，口碑也特别棒。

en: He is a highly paid man.
He is the soul of honor.
He gets a high salary.
He prides himself on having an expensive car.
zh: 他挺得意自己那辆豪车的。

en: He is a man of noble birth.
He is of noble ancestry.
He is a man of noble blood.
He wears expensive clothes and owns a lot of jewelry.
zh: 他穿戴很讲究，还有好多珠宝。

en: He rescued a cat from a high tree.
zh: 他从高树上救下了一只猫。

en: He has a soaring ambition.
He has quite a few valuable paintings.
zh: 他收藏了不少值钱的画。

en: He gets a good salary.
He receives a high salary.
He committed suicide by jumping out of a high window.
zh: 他从高处的窗户跳下去自杀了。

en: He had to pay a high rent for his farm.
He was snoring loudly while he slept.
zh: 他睡觉时呼噜打得震天响。

en: He returned home by way of Hong Kong.
He held up his hands in token of surrender.
He gave in.
He gave up.
He surrendered.
He's quite philosophical about his demotion.
zh: 他对自己被降职这事儿看得很开。

en: He forged the steel into a sword.
zh: 他把那块钢打成了一把剑。

en: He supplemented his lecture with a booklet.
zh: 他发了本小册子来补充讲座内容。

en: He brought his speech to an end.
He cleared his throat before starting the lecture.
zh: 他在开讲前清了清嗓子。

en: He went to the hall to give an address.
He craned his neck to see the procession.
He set out to find his lost mother.
zh: 他动身去找他失踪的母亲了。

en: He went about town looking for his missing dog.
zh: 他在城里到处找他丢了的狗。

en: He was counted as lost.
He is a man of action.
The way he talks and acts, you can tell he's a redneck.
zh: 瞧他那言谈举止，一看就是个乡巴佬。

en: He is deliberate in his action.
He had little freedom of action.
He has no manners at all.
zh: 他这人一点儿礼貌都没有。

en: He has learnt manners.
He is an ill-mannered man.
He is careful about his manners.
He behaved badly.
His good manners predispose people to like him.
zh: 他那得体的举止挺招人喜欢的。

en: He is regretful that he couldn't go.
He said to himself that he should go.
He is not so careless as to take the wrong train.
zh: 他还不至于粗心到坐错火车。

en: He was unwilling to go.
He doesn't want to go; neither do I.
He didn't go, and neither did I.
He didn't go and I didn't either.
He will not go.
He was beaten with an iron rod during a violent soccer match.
zh: 在一场激烈的足球赛中，他被人用铁棍打了。

en: He transformed a piece of waste ground into a beautiful garden.
zh: 他把一片荒地变成了一个漂亮的花园。

en: He has a superficial knowledge of navigation.
He made a positive answer.
He is an archeologist's assistant.
zh: 他是一名考古学家的助手。

en: He is unrealistic.
He brought his ideas into practice.
zh: 他把自己的想法付诸了实践。

en: He is rigid in his views.
He lost hold of the rope and fell into the river.
zh: 他没抓稳绳子，掉进河里了。

en: He caught hold of a rope and saved himself.
zh: 他抓住了绳子，救了自己一命。

en: He ordered a cup of tea.
He dropped lemon juice into his tea.
zh: 他往茶里滴了几滴柠檬汁。

en: He added a little sugar and milk to his tea.
zh: 他往茶里加了点糖和牛奶。

en: He thrust some coins into my pocket.
zh: 他往我兜里塞了几枚硬币。

en: He lives in a port town.
He was promoted to the position of head teacher.
zh: 他被提拔成了教导主任。

en: He was promoted to the position of school principal.
He has just become a principal.
He dislikes the principal.
He set fire to the school building.
He continued his research for a further ten years.
He is frugal, to say the least of it.
zh: 说得好听点，他这人很节俭。

en: He dashed out in confusion.
zh: 他慌慌张张地冲了出去。

en: In haste, he left the door open.
He is possessed of a wide landed property.
zh: 他名下拥有广阔的土地。

en: He crossed the immense pacific on a raft.
zh: 他划着木筏横渡了广阔的太平洋。

en: He works for an advertising agency.
zh: 他在一家广告公司上班。

en: He is the first national politician to be named in a widening corruption scandal.
zh: 他是第一个被卷入这场不断扩大的贪腐丑闻的国家级政客。

en: He has wide views.
He has broad views.
He lives in a large house.
He lived a happy life.
He did not die happily.
He seems happy.
He seems to be happy.
It seems that he's happy.
I believe that he's happy.
I think he's happy.
He is happy. For one thing he's got a promotion and for another he has just got married.
zh: 他很幸福。一方面他升职了，另一方面他刚结婚。

en: He seems quite happy.
He seems to be very happy.
He may well be said to have been a fortunate man.
zh: 可以说他一直是个幸运的人。

en: He was so fortunate as it find a good job.
zh: 他很幸运地找到了一份好工作。

en: He was fortunate to find the book he had lost.
zh: 他运气不错，找到了丢的那本书。

en: He had the fortune to find a job.
zh: 他有幸找到了一份工作。

en: He had the good fortune to be rescued from the burning building.
zh: 他很幸运地从着火的大楼里获救了。

en: He had the good fortune to find a good wife.
zh: 他很有福气，找了个好老婆。

en: He had the fortune to marry a nice girl.
zh: 他很有幸娶了个不错的姑娘。

en: He had the good fortune to marry a pretty girl.
zh: 他很有福气，娶了个漂亮姑娘。

en: He didn't die happily.
He is happy.
He may not be happy.
He felt tired of working in the factory.
He works in a factory.
He has skill in handwork.
He is skilled in handicraft.
He deserves a good reputation.
Curiosity got the better of him.
His curiosity prompted him to ask questions.
zh: 他的好奇心促使他问了几个问题。

en: He is all curiosity.
He bought as many books as he liked.
zh: 他想买多少书就买了多少。

en: He can do whatever he likes with the money.
zh: 这笔钱他想怎么花就怎么花。

en: He lives up there, up on that mountain.
zh: 他就住在山上，那座山上。

en: He took an oral examination.
He whistled for his dog.
He is a man of few words.
He made up an excuse.
He had some money in an account that he'd set aside for his kids.
zh: 他在账户里存了一笔钱，是留给孩子的。

en: He deposited 100 dollars in his saving account.
zh: 他往储蓄账户里存了一百块钱。

en: He drew $100 from his account.
zh: 他从账户里取了一百块钱。

en: He put great emphasis on spoken English.
He held his tongue and didn't say a word.
He may be a poor talker and far from shrewd, but I like him all the better for that.
zh: 他可能不善言辞，也不够精明，但我反而更喜欢他这点。

en: He opened his mouth wide.
He kept his tongue under a bridle.
He stood gazing at the sight with his mouth open.
zh: 他张着嘴，盯着那景象看呆了。

en: He never opens his mouth without complaining about something.
His bark is worse than his bite.
He could not speak, he was so angry.
He grows a mustache.
He shaved his mustache off.
He never fails to do what he says.
He was sitting there with a pipe in his mouth.
zh: 他嘴里叼着烟斗坐在那儿。

en: His answer was to strike me on the head.
zh: 他的回答是往我头上打了一下。

en: He stammered out a few words.
zh: 他结结巴巴地说了几个字。

en: The word yes never escapes his lips.
He is a tight-lipped man.
He had the boldness to ignore the teacher's advice.
zh: 他胆子真大，居然敢不听老师的建议。

en: He had the cheek to ask me to help him.
zh: 他居然还有脸让我帮他。

en: He had the boldness to ignore my advice.
zh: 他居然胆敢不听我的劝告。

en: He had the nerve to ask me to marry him.
zh: 他居然好意思跟我求婚。

en: He wears thick glasses.
He went to Osaka on official business.
He was educated at a public school.
zh: 他是在公立学校读的书。

en: He insulted me in public.
He has gone to Paris on official business.
He found a public telephone and called a taxi.
zh: 他找了个公用电话叫了辆出租车。

en: He embezzled public money.
He was arrested for abusing public funds.
zh: 他因为滥用公款被捕了。

en: He was arrested for misappropriating public funds.
zh: 他因为挪用公款被抓了。

en: He likes walking in the park.
He came across his old friend while walking in the park.
zh: 他在公园散步的时候偶遇了老朋友。

en: He rode a bus to the park.
He likes to walk about in the park.
He may be jogging around the park.
zh: 他可能在公园里跑步呢。

en: He sat on the bench in the park.
He's somewhere about the park.
zh: 他在公园里哪儿待着呢。

en: He's somewhere in the park.
zh: 他在公园里的某个地方。

en: He went to the park, where he took a rest.
zh: 他去了公园，在那儿歇了会儿。

en: He calculated the speed of light.
He himself was not the light.
He met with a traffic accident.
He was in a traffic accident.
He had a traffic accident.
He was involved in a traffic accident.
He didn't notice the small video camera above the traffic signal.
zh: 他没注意到信号灯上面的那个小摄像头。

en: He met with a traffic accident and had a narrow escape from death.
He lost his life in a traffic accident.
He lost the sight of one eye in a traffic accident.
zh: 他在车祸里一只眼睛瞎了。

en: He suffered internal injuries in the car accident.
He got injured in a traffic accident.
He lost his son in the traffic accident.
zh: 他在那场车祸中失去了儿子。

en: He was seriously injured in a traffic accident.
The traffic accident deprived him of his sight.
He died in the traffic accident.
He was slightly injured in a traffic accident.
zh: 他在车祸中受了点轻伤。

en: He had a narrow escape in the traffic accident.
zh: 他在那场车祸中捡回一条命。

en: He was injured in a traffic accident.
zh: 他在交通事故里受伤了。

en: He can't walk now because he got injured in a traffic accident.
zh: 他因为出了车祸受了伤，现在没法走路。

en: He drives a hard bargain.
He failed to see the stop sign at the intersection and hit an oncoming car.
zh: 他没看到路口的停止标志，撞上了迎面而来的车。

en: He is a hard man to deal with.
He feels no reluctance in acknowledging errors.
He regrets his mistake.
He has no friends to talk with.
zh: 他连个能说话的朋友都没有。

en: He is easily led.
He's easy to handle.
He's easily controlled.
He lived quietly in the latter years of his life.
zh: 他的晚年生活过得很平静。

en: He sighed with regret.
He looked back.
He looked back at the pretty girl.
zh: 他回头看了看那个漂亮的女孩。

en: He shut the door that was behind him.
zh: 他顺手关上了身后的门。

en: He will join us later.
zh: 他待会儿会跟我们汇合。

en: He remained abroad later on.
zh: 后来他就一直留在国外。

en: He will come afterwards.
He may change his mind later.
zh: 他过会儿可能会改主意。

en: He is never in the office in the morning.
zh: 他上午从来不在办公室。

en: He is not always busy in the morning.
zh: 他上午并不总是那么忙。

en: He goes on duty at 9 a.m. and come off duty at 6 p.m.
zh: 他早上九点上班，下午六点下班。

en: He is supposed to come here at 9 p. m.
zh: 他应该晚上九点过来的。

en: He will come this afternoon.
He's spent all afternoon rooting up last year's spinach plants.
zh: 他一下午都在拔去年的菠菜。

en: He should arrive at the airport by 9 a.m.
zh: 他九点前应该能到机场。

en: He is supposed to come here at 9 p.m.
zh: 他本该晚上九点过来的。

en: He came at three in the afternoon.
He is better off now than he was five years ago.
zh: 他现在的日子比五年前好过。

en: He is far better off now than he was five years ago.
zh: 他现在的日子比五年前强多了。

en: He is far better off than he was five years ago.
zh: 他比五年前过得好多了。

en: I hear he was released after five years in prison.
zh: 我听说他坐了五年牢，刚被放出来。

en: He was set free after doing five years in prison.
zh: 他坐了五年牢后重获自由了。

en: He will arrive on the afternoon of the 5th.
He comes here every five days.
He will get back from school.
He is to come here at five.
He was struck with polio when he was five.
zh: 他五岁那年得了小儿麻痹。

en: He went to Paris at the end of May.
He took the elevator to the 5th floor.
He cheated his clients out of a lot of money.
He had not been employed two months before he was fired.
zh: 他还没干满两个月就被开了。

en: He had words with his employer and was fired.
zh: 他跟老板吵了一架，被开了。

en: He conducted us on a tour around the lake.
zh: 他带我们在湖边转了转。

en: He wandered around the lake.
He ran down to the lake.
He threw a stone into the lake.
He could swim free in the lake.
zh: 他在湖里可以自由自在地游泳。

en: He was exiled from his own country.
zh: 他被自己的国家放逐了。

en: He left home for Spain.
He left home never to return.
He dreamed about his home.
He retired to his hometown, where he lived a quiet life.
zh: 他退休后回了老家，过着清静的日子。

en: He left his native village never to return.
zh: 他离开了家乡，再也没回去。

en: He returned to his native village.
He settled down in his native country.
A successful local boy is coming home.
zh: 那个有出息的本地小伙子要回乡了。

en: He leads a happy life in his hometown.
He lives far away from his hometown.
He deliberately exposed her to danger.
He made a mistake on purpose.
He told deliberate lies.
He deliberately broke the glass.
He made for the door.
He made for the door and tried to escape.
He painted the door over white.
He was roused by a knocking at the door.
He left the door open.
He gave a rap on the door.
He knocked the door with a tap.
He hid himself behind the door.
He was roused by a loud knocking at the door.
zh: 他被一阵大声的敲门声吵醒了。

en: It was his fate to live a lonely life.
zh: 他命中注定要孤独一生。

en: He delivered the package to the orphanage.
zh: 他把包裹送到了孤儿院。

en: He had trouble breathing.
He was sent for and had to go.
He is as great an artist as lived.
zh: 他是史上最伟大的艺术家之一。

en: He is as great a scientist as ever lived.
zh: 他是史上最伟大的科学家之一。

en: He is as great a statesman as ever lived.
zh: 他是史上最伟大的政治家之一。

en: He chanced on a rare book at a second-hand bookstore.
zh: 他在旧书店偶然发现了一本稀有的书。

en: He is a man with a classical education.
He wrote a novel based on ancient myths.
zh: 他写了一本以古代神话为题材的小说。

en: He is well acquainted with ancient history.
He likes collecting old coins.
He is as great a poet as ever lived.
zh: 他是史上最伟大的诗人之一。

en: He is the greatest architect that has ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最伟大的建筑师。

en: He is the greatest statesman that ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最伟大的政治家。

en: He cast his old friends aside.
He turned his back on the old tradition.
He turned his back on the old traditions.
He exchanged his old car for a new one.
He traded his old car in for a new one.
zh: 他拿旧车抵钱换了辆新车。

en: He wore old shoes.
He was playing football with an old tin.
zh: 他当时在拿一个旧铁罐踢足球。

en: He was playing football with an empty can.
zh: 他当时在拿一个空罐头踢足球。

en: He had the old machine fixed.
zh: 他找人修好了那台旧机器。

en: He disposed of his old house.
He is dressed in an old tweed suit.
zh: 他穿着一套旧的花呢西装。

en: He found an old, broken chair and sat down at the piano.
zh: 他找了把破旧的椅子，在钢琴旁坐了下来。

en: He has a strong personality.
He tends to place more stress on society in general than on individual.
zh: 与个人相比，他往往更看重社会整体。

en: He is brief of speech.
He is a man of few words, but he always keeps his promise.
zh: 他话不多，但向来言而有信。

en: He chose his words carefully.
He has the faculty to learn languages easily.
He didn't know how to express himself.
zh: 他不知道该怎么表达自己。

en: He chose every word with care.
His actions do not correspond with his words.
He tried to speak by word or gesture.
zh: 他试着用语言或手势来交流。

en: He got himself committed to it.
His deeds didn't agree with his words.
zh: 他的所作所为和说的不符。

en: His words don't line up with his actions.
zh: 他说话和做事对不上号。

en: He is kind in word and deed.
He has a great knowledge of the linguistic field.
zh: 他在语言学领域知识渊博。

en: He is absorbed in the study of linguistics.
He is at home in phonetics as well as linguistics.
zh: 他对语音学和语言学都很精通。

en: He did what he was told.
He did what he had been told; otherwise he would have been scolded.
zh: 他按吩咐做了，不然会被骂。

en: He had no choice but to do as he was told.
He came early, as he had been asked to do.
He did it as he had been told.
He did what he had been told.
